title: Ticket #7745: Provide implementation of a Personal Pool object in Python
description:
In the Personal HTCondor Pool design doc (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1XiMIMvd_RF2oM5veL2c1wfgHDcdSulorIqjIKeNa5eg/edit?usp=sharing), we've been working on describing what a personal pool really is, beyond just a set of configuration options that we vaguely understand.

Part of that work is to define a model for a personal pool as an object. This ticket is about implementing that object model in the Python bindings as a public API for people to use.

Related: #7669, #7684
remarks:
2020-Aug-10 15:06:18 by karpel:
Assigning to tlmiller for initial round of review. No real docs or walkthrough yet... please ping me if you want a quick demo of what it looks like in action.

2020-Aug-11 14:50:23 by tlmiller:
Code Review

Looks good; I like the daemon-name convenience methods for getting htcondor.* objects directly from the personal condor object (although the current implementation makes me a little nervous).

In particular, by fiddling with the value of CONDOR_CONFIG at runtime, the =_write_config_ method as-written could INHERIT variables from something other than the "system" (e.g., the CONDOR_CONFIG in the environment when the Python process started). This is not the intended behavior, but it should be fixable by storing the CONDOR_CONFIG as set at import time. (If the user desires to INHERIT from another personal condor object, that functionality can be added later.) This fix should be made even if the above implementation is fixed, because the context manager(s) for the personal condor(s) must set the CONDOR_CONFIG environment variable.

In _wait_for_ready, it's probably worth dumping the stderr from condor_who if the stdout is unexpectedly empty.

2020-Aug-14 09:26:46 by karpel:
Second two points resolved (condor_who stderr in debug message when stdout is unexpectedly empty; inherit params during startup instead of when writing config).

I too am now very unsure of the environment-based daemon selection. I think I need to rewrite it based on #7670, or at least using explicit locates.

2020-Aug-21 14:29:07 by karpel:
Merged into master; docs are done on this side, but we should add a tutorial for this, so still docpending (GH issue: https://github.com/htcondor/htcondor-python-bindings-tutorials/issues/22)
